word_mean: 磨损，磨耗：某一物质或结构(如皮肤或牙齿)因某种不寻常或异常的机械动作而被磨损。另见planing
擦伤：通过某种不寻常或异常的机械动作致使体表皮肤或粘膜脱失

sentence.Network_en: Diamonds have extreme resistance to abrasion.
Abrasion tests are universally carried out under atmospheric conditions.
sentence.Network_cn: 耐磨试验通常在常压条件下进行.

sentence.Network_en: Erosion of pipes and vessels from abrasion by particles can be serious.
sentence.Network_cn: 由于固体颗粒的磨蚀作用,管子和容器的磨损严重.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Latin abrasio(n-), from the verb abradere (see abrade)

entry.def: An abrasion is an area on a person's body where the skin has been scraped.

example.ex: He had severe abrasions to his right cheek.
example.tran: 他的右脸颊有严重的擦伤。

means.word_mean: 1. an abraded area where the skin is torn or worn off
3. the wearing down of rock particles by friction due to water or wind or ice
